identity.name: myNewscast
identity.tagline: Making local government meetings searchable with AI
identity.description: Civic transparency platform that uses AI to automatically transcribe, process, and make government meetings searchable. Rebuilds the civic content infrastructure that collapsed when classified ad revenue was extracted from local journalism. Processes meetings at $0.40 each.

capabilities.summary: AI-powered platform that ingests government meeting recordings (city council, planning commissions, school boards, etc.), generates accurate transcriptions, identifies speakers and agenda items, extracts key decisions and votes, and makes everything full-text searchable. Enables citizens, journalists, and researchers to find what happened in local government without watching hours of video. B2B API available for media companies and civic tech organizations. Hyperlocal advertising platform for sustainable revenue.
solves: I can't watch 4-hour city council meetings but need to know what was decided
local news doesn't cover government meetings anymore
I need to search past government meetings for mentions of a specific topic
our newsroom can't afford to send reporters to every public meeting
citizens have no easy way to track what local government is doing
government transparency requires making public meetings actually accessible
ideal_for: local government agencies wanting to improve transparency
citizens who want to follow local government decisions
local news organizations needing civic content at scale
civic tech organizations and transparency advocates
differentiators: Processes government meetings at $0.40 each — makes civic content economically viable
Purpose-built for government meetings, not generic transcription
Searchable archive of local government decisions
Addresses the civic content collapse caused by loss of local journalism revenue
B2B API for media companies plus hyperlocal advertising model

shares_with: none — meeting content is public record
